docs.text: the real blonde ( r ) a woman's face , an arm , some pumped-up pectorals , blond hair , a man's sad face , slender legs , a random hand here and there .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as the opening credits of tom dicillo's the real blonde unfold , these scattered , fractured glimpses eventually come together to form the image of a bikini brief-clad man on his knees clinging to a nurturing woman , his head concealing her unclothed breasts .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if only the rest of this formless , aimless ensemble comedy assembled so coherently .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: joe ( matthew modine ) is a waiter/struggling actor too proud to take gigs in commercials or soap operas .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he's feeling somewhat dissatisfied with his relationship with his live-in love , mary ( catherine keener ) , who holds some subconscious hostility toward the male gender .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: mary , a makeup artist , regularly works on model sahara ( bridgette wilson ) , who is obsessed with the underlying messages in disney's the little mermaid .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the bottle blonde has a turbulent on-again , off-again relationship with bob ( maxwell caulfield ) , a soap actor who yearns for the taste of a real blonde , which he finds in co-star kelly ( daryl hannah ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as the film unspools , a variety of other characters pass through : fashion photographer blair ( marlo thomas ) ; mary's shrink ( buck henry ) and self-defense instructor ( denis leary ) ; joe's casting agent ( kathleen turner ) and hardass boss ( christopher lloyd ) ; and a mystery woman ( elizabeth berkley ) who keeps on crossing joe's path .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: where exactly does all this go ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that's a question best posed to writer-director dicillo , who doesn't appear to have the slightest clue himself .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: his meandering , largely unfunny script and direction are like hopelessly lost drivers , turning into dead-end narrative streets only to reverse course and hit another creative cul-de-sac .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and another .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and another .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: at one point bob , frustrated with the soap scripts , complains to the head writer ( jim fyfe ) that his and kelly's characters keep on going in circles , with no hint of development or growth .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that is most certainly the case here .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: joe gets a job and ultimately botches things ; he and mary bicker ; they make up , only to have the pattern repeat itself .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: unhappy with his bottle blonde , bob gets his real blonde but is unsatisfied ; he returns to the faux and is still unsatisfied .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if there is a point to all of this , dicillo dances around it , spending his time on apparent digressions that , as it turns out , aren't digressions at all .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the real blonde is not without some amusements .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it does have the occasional funny line and situation ; leary , henry , lloyd , steve buscemi , and dave chappelle shine in their small roles ; keener is a likable , refreshingly earthy lead ; berkley's appearance is mercifully brief ( she receives outrageously prominent billing and ad placement for a ten-minute role ) ; and there is the irony of having caulfield play a wildly popular soap star who makes the ratings skyrocket ( last year , the actor was fired from the daytime drama all my children after a scant six months--due to lack of viewer interest ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but on the whole , the real blonde is a frustrating sit that lives up to the stereotypes of its title--it may be glossy on the surface , but there's nothing going on inside .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ( opens february 27 )
docs.label: negative
